thread.title: Two years on: 'He's left a massive Simba shaped hole in my life,' says Jonathan Boynton-Lee
thread.title_full: Two years on: 'He's left a massive Simba shaped hole in my life,' says Jonathan Boynton-Lee

title: Two years on: 'He's left a massive Simba shaped hole in my life,' says Jonathan Boynton-Lee
text:
WATCH: Dr Malinga's emotional musical tribute to Lundi and Sfiso 
Fellow Top Billing presenter Jonathan Boynton-Lee who was as close to Simba as a brother, says that he "misses him every day." 
"I miss him more and more every day, but there's so much love and that keeps him alive," he tells TshisaLIVE. 
Jonathan says that he does not believe that time heals all wounds. "It's said that 'time heals all wounds.' I do not agree, the wounds remain. In time, the mind, protecting its sanity covers them with scar tissue and the pain lessens, but it is never gone." 
The TV personality adds that Simba has left a gaping hole in his life that can never be filled. 
"He's left a massive shaped hole in my life that no one will ever fill." 
Simba and his friend, Kady-Shay O’Bryan, who was a passenger in the car died at the scene of accident on William Nicol Drive in Fourways‚ Johannesburg on January 31‚ 2015. 
Meanwhile, Preshalin Naidoo, the man accused of causing the accident is set to appear in the Randburg Magistrate' Court on March 6 when the trial resumes. Share
